definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: have a bad smell, stink (Ar. biy’sa be evil, Aram. [[בְּאֵשׁ]], be04 be evil, As. bîšu Lotz:TP 78)—

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Pf. [[וּבָאַשׁ]] consec. Ex 7:18; Impf. [[וַיִּבְאַשׁ]] v:Ex 7:21, [[־אַָשׁ]] Ex 16:20; 3 fs. [[תִּבְאַשׁ]] Is 50:2; [[וַתִּבְאַשׁ]] Ex 8:10; —stink, of Nile, on account of dead fish Ex 7:18, Ex 7:21 (E); of land of Egypt, owing to dead frogs Ex 8:10 (J); of manna kept over Ex 16:20 (P ? or R) [[וַיׇּרֻם תּוֹלָעִים וַיִּבְאַָשׁ]] and it grew foul (rotten, decayed) with worms, and stank; Is 50:2 [[תִּבְאַשׁ דְּגׇתָם מֵאֵין מַיִם וְתָמׂת בַּצָּמָא]] their fish stink for lack of water, etc. (LXX Lo Di rd. [[תִּיבַשׁ]], dry up and die, which suits ‖, but not the usage of [[יׇבֵשׁ]]).

definitions.title: Niph.
definitions.body: Pf. [[נִבְאַשׁ]] 1Sa 13:4; [[נִבְאֲשׁוּ]] 2Sa 10:6; [[נִבְאַשְׁתָּ]] 2Sa 16:2; —only fig. make oneself odious, become odious (cf. Eng. be in bad odour), sq. [[אֵת]] with = towards; [[נִבְאַשְׁתָּ אֶת־אָבִיךָ]] 2Sa 16:21 thou hast become odious with thy father; also sq. [[בְּ]] (rather strangely) 1Sa 13:4 Isr. made themselves odious to the Philistines; 2Sa 10:6 Ammonites to David.

emit a stinking odour Ex 16:24 of manna (cf. Qal v:20); Ps 38:6 [[הִבְאִישׁוּ נׇמַקּוּ חַבּוּרׂתָָי]] my wounds have grown stinking, they have festered (of chastisement for sin); 1Sa 17:12 fig. of David [[הַבְאֵשׁ הִבְאִישׁ בְּעַמּוֹ]] he hath become utterly abhorred among his people.

cause to stink, [[זְבוּבֵי מָוֶת יַבְאִישׁ יַבִּיעַ שֶׁמֶן רוֹקֵָחַ]] dead flies cause to stink (and) to ferment the oil of a perfumer; usually fig. [[הִבְאַשְׁתֶּם אֶת־רֵיחֵנוּ]] Ex 5:21 (J), i.e. ye have made us odious, sq. [[בְּעֵינֵי]], cf. (c. acc. pers.) Ge 34:30 sq. [[בְ]]; also without obj. Pr 13:5 a wicked man makes odious and shameful (De Now Str; Be Ew Hi Zö acts odiously and shamefully).

definitions.title: Hithp.
definitions.body: Pf. [[הִתְבָּאֲשׁוּ]] 1Ch 19:6 they had made themselves odious (= Niph. in ‖ 2Sa 10:6), sq. [[עִם]].
